sites.name: Badrinath Temple
sites.quick_version: High-altitude Vishnu temple, one of Char Dham, opens May-Nov only.
sites.short_history: Established by Adi Shankaracharya in 8th century CE. One of four Char Dham pilgrimage sites dedicated to Lord Vishnu.
sites.mythological_significance: Vishnu meditated here as Badrinarayan. Goddess Lakshmi shielded him as Badri tree. Represents Satya Yuga. Black stone deity in meditative posture.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Dawn and dusk aarti. Tapt Kund hot spring bath before darshan. Opens May, closes November due to snow.
sites.local_travel_tips: Warm clothing essential. Book advance. Acclimatize for altitude. Helicopter from Dehradun available.
sites.nearby_attractions: Mana Village (last Indian village), Vasudhara Falls, Charan Paduka, Neelkanth Peak
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Temple closes in November - deity moved to Joshimath. Many arrive after closure. Check dates.

sites.name: Dwarka Dwarkadhish Temple
sites.quick_version: Krishna's ancient capital temple on Arabian Sea, one of Char Dham.
sites.short_history: Ancient temple city 2500+ years old. Current structure 15th-16th century. Krishna's legendary kingdom capital.
sites.mythological_significance: Krishna's capital after leaving Mathura. Represents Dvapara Yuga. Black stone Krishna deity as King of Dwarka.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Five daily aartis from Mangala to Shayan. Abhishek daily. Afternoon closure. No photography in sanctum.
sites.local_travel_tips: Visit Bet Dwarka island by boat. No shorts/sleeveless. Combine with Somnath (230 km).
sites.nearby_attractions: Bet Dwarka, Nageshwar Jyotirlinga, Rukmini Temple, Gomti Ghat
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Bet Dwarka island visit essential - pilgrimage incomplete without it. Many skip due to time.

sites.name: Jagannath Puri Temple
sites.quick_version: Famous Krishna temple with Rath Yatra, non-Hindus not allowed inside.
sites.short_history: 12th century CE by King Anantavarman. Famous annual Rath Yatra attracts millions.
sites.mythological_significance: Jagannath (Krishna) with siblings Balabhadra and Subhadra. Represents Kali Yuga. Flag flies opposite to wind.
sites.rituals_and_practices: 56 types of mahaprasad daily. Snana Yatra bathing ritual. Rath Yatra chariot festival. Non-Hindus restricted.
sites.local_travel_tips: Book online darshan tickets. Try mahaprasad from Anand Bazaar. Puri Beach sunrise beautiful.
sites.nearby_attractions: Puri Beach, Konark Sun Temple (35 km), Chilika Lake, Raghurajpur art village
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Non-Hindus cannot enter temple. View from nearby rooftops. Rath Yatra needs 6-month advance booking.

sites.name: Rameshwaram Temple
sites.quick_version: Southern Char Dham with 22 holy wells, Ram worshipped Shiva here.
sites.short_history: Ram established Shiva worship here before Lanka war. Longest temple corridor (1220m). Char Dham + Jyotirlinga significance.
sites.mythological_significance: Ram worshipped Shiva to absolve Ravana-killing sin. Represents Treta Yuga. 22 sacred well baths highly auspicious.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Bathing in 22 theerthams before darshan traditional. 4 AM abhishekam. Shivaratri special. Kashi-Rameshwaram pilgrimage complete cycle.
sites.local_travel_tips: Quick-dry clothes for theertham bath. Visit Dhanushkodi ghost town. Pamban Bridge scenic. Avoid peak summer heat.
sites.nearby_attractions: Dhanushkodi, Pamban Bridge, Abdul Kalam Memorial, Gandhamadhana Parvatham
sites.avoid_common_mistake: 22 theertham bath takes 2-3 hours. Don't rush - tradition requires all 22 for complete merit.

sites.name: Kedarnath Temple
sites.type: Jyotirlinga, Panch Kedar, Chota Char Dham
sites.quick_version: High-altitude Shiva Jyotirlinga requiring trek, survived 2013 floods miraculously.
sites.short_history: Adi Shankaracharya established. Northernmost Jyotirlinga. Survived 2013 devastating floods when rock diverted debris. Open 6 months yearly.
sites.mythological_significance: Pandavas sought Shiva's forgiveness post-Kurukshetra. Shiva appeared as bull. His hump remained at Kedarnath. Triangular rock represents hump.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Opens Akshaya Tritiya (April/May), closes Bhai Dooj (November). Morning/evening aarti. Winter deity at Ukhimath. 16 km trek or helicopter.
sites.local_travel_tips: Online registration mandatory. Oxygen cans, warm clothes essential. Acclimatize at Gaurikund. Ponies/palanquins/helicopter available. Weather unpredictable.
sites.nearby_attractions: Bhairavnath Temple, Gandhi Sarovar, Vasuki Tal, Sonprayag, Triyuginarayan Temple
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Don't underestimate trek difficulty. Altitude sickness real. Acclimatize properly at Gaurikund minimum 1 day.

sites.name: Somnath Temple
sites.quick_version: First Jyotirlinga on Arabian Sea, destroyed and rebuilt 17 times.
sites.short_history: First of 12 Jyotirlingas. Destroyed 17 times, rebuilt after 1951 independence. Located on Arabian Sea shore.
sites.mythological_significance: Moon God (Chandra) regained luster worshipping Shiva here. Somnath = Lord of Moon. Banastambha pillar points to Antarctica.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Three aartis daily. Evening sound & light show narrates history. Rudrabhishek available. Full moon beach darshan significant.
sites.local_travel_tips: Evening sound-light show must-see. Beach sunset spectacular. Triveni Sangam nearby. Photography allowed. Combine Dwarka (230 km).
sites.nearby_attractions: Bhalka Tirtha, Prabhas Patan Museum, Triveni Sangam, Dehotsarg Teerth
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Sound-light show timing crucial - don't miss this powerful narration of temple's resilient history.

sites.name: Mahakaleshwar Temple
sites.quick_version: Only south-facing Jyotirlinga with unique Bhasma Aarti using cremation ash.
sites.short_history: One of 12 Jyotirlingas on Shipra river. Ujjain is one of seven sacred cities. Mentioned in ancient texts.
sites.mythological_significance: Only Dakshinamukhi (south-facing) Jyotirlinga. Protects from untimely death. Shiva destroyed demon Dushana here. Bhasma Aarti uses cremation ash.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Famous 4 AM Bhasma Aarti with cremation ash - advance booking essential. Regular aartis throughout. Mahashivratri massive gathering. Kumbh every 12 years.
sites.local_travel_tips: Book Bhasma Aarti 2-3 months advance online. Arrive 3:30 AM. Dress modestly. Visit Ram Ghat, Kal Bhairav temple. Jantar Mantar observatory nearby.
sites.nearby_attractions: Kal Bhairav Temple, Ram Ghat, Harsiddhi Temple, Vedh Shala Observatory, Sandipani Ashram
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Bhasma Aarti fills months ahead - book immediately. Without booking cannot attend this unique ritual.

sites.name: Omkareshwar Temple
sites.quick_version: Jyotirlinga on Om-shaped island in sacred Narmada river.
sites.short_history: 12th century temple on Mandhata island shaped like Om symbol. Narmada river flows creating Om shape visible from above.
sites.mythological_significance: Shiva pleased by Vindhya mountains' prayers. Two forms - Omkareshwar and Mamleshwar on opposite banks. Narmada parikrama highly meritorious.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Morning/evening aarti. Boat crossing to island. Mondays and Shravan auspicious. Island parikrama 3-4 hours. Narmada considered very sacred.
sites.local_travel_tips: Boat to island temple. Comfortable shoes for parikrama. Visit both Omkareshwar and Mamleshwar. Sunset from hanging bridge spectacular.
sites.nearby_attractions: Mamleshwar Temple, Siddhanath Temple, 24 Avatars temples, Satmatrika temples, Gauri Somnath
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Don't miss Mamleshwar on opposite bank - pilgrimage incomplete without both Shiva forms.

sites.name: Kashi Vishwanath Temple
sites.quick_version: Most sacred Shiva temple in holiest city, dying here grants moksha.
sites.short_history: In world's oldest continuously inhabited city. Current structure 1780 by Rani Ahilyabai Holkar. Kashi Vishwanath Corridor 2021 expansion. Gold plating by Maharaja Ranjit Singh.
sites.mythological_significance: Kashi = City of Light, Shiva's eternal abode. Dying here grants moksha (liberation). Vishwanath = Lord of Universe. Jyotirlinga of infinite light.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Morning Mangala Aarti 3 AM. Ganga bath before darshan traditional. Mondays peak. Shravan month extremely crowded. Electronics not allowed - strict security.
sites.local_travel_tips: Online booking recommended. Avoid Mondays. No phones/electronics. Ganga Aarti at Dashashwamedh Ghat spectacular. Early morning 3-5 AM least crowded. Explore 84 ghats.
sites.nearby_attractions: Dashashwamedh Ghat, Manikarnika Ghat, Assi Ghat, Ramnagar Fort, Sarnath (Buddha site 10 km)
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Don't bring phones - strict security. Mondays 70% more crowded. Any other weekday better. Corridor improved flow but Shravan/festivals still overwhelming.

sites.name: Kamakhya Temple
sites.quick_version: Most powerful Shaktipeetha, Ambubachi Mela celebrates goddess's menstruation.
sites.short_history: Ancient Shaktipeetha on Nilachal Hill. Temple rebuilt multiple times. Major tantric worship center. Sati's womb fell here.
sites.mythological_significance: Sati's reproductive organs fell here when Vishnu dismembered her body. Most powerful of 51 Shaktipeethas. Goddess worshipped as Kamakhya, source of desires. No idol - yoni-shaped stone in sanctum.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Ambubachi Mela June - temple closed 3 days during goddess's menstruation. Tantric rituals prominent. Animal sacrifice practiced. Red cloth distributed as prasad symbolizing fertility.
sites.local_travel_tips: Steep climb to temple. Ambubachi Mela brings tantric practitioners - city infrastructure strained. Temple closed 3 days, opens 4th day with max crowds. Regular days manageable.
sites.nearby_attractions: Brahmaputra River, Umananda Island, Assam State Museum, Pobitora Wildlife Sanctuary
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Ambubachi temple closed 3 days. Opens 4th day with maximum crowds. Plan accordingly or avoid Ambubachi.

sites.name: Tirupati Balaji Temple
sites.quick_version: World's richest and most visited temple, hair offering tradition.
sites.short_history: Ancient temple atop Tirumala Hills. Receives richest donations globally. 50,000-100,000 daily visitors. Elaborate gold ornaments and treasures.
sites.mythological_significance: Lord Venkateswara (Vishnu) avatar. Married Goddess Padmavati. Devotees offer hair to fulfill vows - world's largest tonsure operation. Believed to grant wishes and clear debts.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Daily worship elaborate. Hair offering (tonsure) major tradition. Free darshan 18-24 hours wait. Special entry Rs 300 saves 15-20 hours. Brahmotsavam 9-day festival September. Laddu prasad famous.
sites.local_travel_tips: Book Rs 300 special entry 2-3 months advance - saves 18-20 hours. Free darshan brutal 20+ hour wait. Online booking mandatory. Accommodation booking essential. Avoid weekends/holidays. Laddu prasad counter separate.
sites.nearby_attractions: Sri Padmavathi Temple, Akasaganga Waterfall, Silathoranam rock arch, Talakona Waterfalls
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Free darshan is 18-24 hour ordeal. Rs 300 special entry worth every rupee - saves entire day. Many tourists don't know and suffer.

sites.name: Golden Temple (Harmandir Sahib)
sites.quick_version: Most sacred Sikh shrine, open 24/7, free langar feeds 100,000 daily.
sites.short_history: Built by Guru Arjan Dev 1604. Destroyed and rebuilt multiple times. Gold plating by Maharaja Ranjit Singh 19th century. Central structure surrounded by Amrit Sarovar (holy pool).
sites.mythological_significance: Guru Granth Sahib enshrined inside. Four entrances symbolize openness to all. Gold structure represents spiritual and temporal wealth. Amrit Sarovar nectar pool considered healing.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Guru Granth Sahib ceremonially brought to sanctum early morning (Amrit Vela 3-5 AM), taken back at night (Palki ceremony). Continuous kirtan (devotional singing). Free langar 24/7 feeds 100,000+ daily - world's largest community kitchen. Head covering mandatory, remove shoes.
sites.local_travel_tips: Visit 3-5 AM Amrit Vela for serene experience and Palki ceremony. Participate in langar (free kitchen). Explore Jallianwala Bagh nearby. Wagah Border ceremony 30 km. Head covering provided. Volunteer in langar kitchen - moving experience.
sites.nearby_attractions: Jallianwala Bagh, Partition Museum, Wagah Border, Gobindgarh Fort
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Don't visit only during day - magical 3-5 AM Amrit Vela experience when Guru Granth Sahib brought to sanctum. Peaceful and deeply spiritual.

sites.name: Vaishno Devi Temple
sites.quick_version: Cave shrine of Goddess, 13 km trek, second most visited temple after Tirupati.
sites.short_history: Ancient cave shrine in Trikuta Mountains. 8-10 million annual visitors. Developed infrastructure with online booking, RFID tracking, helicopter services.
sites.mythological_significance: Goddess Vaishno Devi (Shakti manifestation) meditated in cave. Defeated demon Bhairon Nath. Three pindis (natural rock formations) represent Maha Kali, Maha Lakshmi, Maha Saraswati.
sites.rituals_and_practices: 13 km trek from Katra base or helicopter to Sanjichhat (2.5 km remaining). Night treks popular. Cave darshan queue 1-3 hours additional. Bhawan (temple complex) accommodation. Return via Ardhkuwari cave optional.
sites.best_season: March-April, September-October (avoid winter snow and summer heat)
sites.local_travel_tips: Online registration helps. Helicopter till Sanjichhat saves time but 2.5 km trek remains. Physical fitness needed. Night treks cooler. Ponies/palanquins available. Navratri periods overwhelming. Weather changes quickly - carry layers.
sites.nearby_attractions: Bhairon Temple (pilgrimage complete after visiting), Ardhkuwari Cave, Banganga, Shivkhori Cave Temple
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Helicopter doesn't reach cave - only till Sanjichhat. 2.5 km walking mandatory. Many assume helicopter means no physical effort.

sites.name: Meenakshi Amman Temple
sites.quick_version: Architectural marvel with colorful gopurams, dedicated to Goddess Meenakshi.
sites.short_history: Ancient temple, current structure 17th century by Nayak rulers. Dravidian architecture masterpiece with 14 gopurams (towers). 33,000 sculptures.
sites.mythological_significance: Goddess Parvati as Meenakshi (fish-eyed goddess) married Lord Sundareshwarar (Shiva). She was warrior queen of Madurai. Temple represents her royal palace. Fridays dedicated to goddess.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Ten daily rituals from morning awakening to night sleep ceremony. Meenakshi Thirukalyanam (divine wedding) reenacted during Chithirai Festival April-May. Fridays busiest. Evening aarti spectacular.
sites.local_travel_tips: Avoid Fridays if possible - goddess's day brings 3x crowds. Chithirai Festival chariot procession draws 1 million+. Special darshan tickets available. Explore 14 gopurams. Photography restrictions inside. Hall of Thousand Pillars architectural wonder.
sites.nearby_attractions: Thirumalai Nayak Palace, Gandhi Museum, Alagar Kovil Temple, Vandiyur Mariamman Teppakulam
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Fridays see 3x normal crowds. Visit Monday-Thursday for better experience. Also temple closes midday - plan timing.

sites.name: Shirdi Sai Baba Temple
sites.quick_version: Modern saint Sai Baba's shrine, Thursdays insanely crowded.
sites.short_history: Sai Baba lived in Shirdi late 19th to early 20th century. Died 1918. Temple built at his samadhi (burial site). Grew from small shrine to massive temple complex.
sites.mythological_significance: Sai Baba taught unity of all religions. Lived in mosque (Dwarkamai), buried in Hindu temple. Performed miracles of healing and materialization. Devotees believe he still fulfills wishes. Udi (holy ash) distributed as prasad.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Kakad Aarti 4 AM, Madhyan Aarti noon, Dhoop Aarti sunset, Shej Aarti night. Thursdays Sai Baba's day - avoid at all costs (10+ hour waits). Online darshan booking essential. Free accommodation available. Trust runs extensive charitable activities.
sites.local_travel_tips: NEVER visit Thursday - 10+ hour waits common. Online booking saves hours. VIP darshan faster but costly. Free accommodation must be booked months advance. Visit Dwarkamai, Chavadi, Lendi Garden. Participate in aarti. Morning darshan less crowded.
sites.nearby_attractions: Dwarkamai Mosque, Chavadi, Lendi Garden, Khandoba Temple, Shani Shingnapur (70 km)
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Thursday is weekly peak - 10+ hour waits. Visit any other weekday for 70% less crowd with same spiritual experience.

sites.name: Haridwar
sites.quick_version: Gateway to Himalayas, Ganga Aarti at Har Ki Pauri, Kumbh Mela host.
sites.short_history: One of seven holiest places in Hinduism. Gateway to Char Dham pilgrimage. Kumbh Mela every 12 years, Ardh Kumbh every 6 years. Ancient city mentioned in epics.
sites.mythological_significance: Ganga enters plains from Himalayas here. Har Ki Pauri (footsteps of God) where Vishnu's footprint appears. Amrit drops fell here during Samudra Manthan. Bathing in Ganga here washes sins. Dying here grants moksha.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Evening Ganga Aarti at Har Ki Pauri most spectacular. Hundreds of diyas floated on Ganga. Morning bath at Brahma Kund auspicious. Shradh rituals for ancestors. Asthi visarjan (ashes immersion). Kavad Yatra July-August brings millions.
sites.local_travel_tips: Arrive 30 min early for Aarti good spot. Kumbh/Ardh Kumbh book 6+ months ahead. Avoid Kavad Yatra July-August unless experiencing it intentionally. Mansa Devi, Chandi Devi temples via cable car. Combine with Rishikesh (25 km). No leather items near ghats. Beware touts.
sites.nearby_attractions: Mansa Devi Temple, Chandi Devi Temple, Maya Devi Temple, Rajaji National Park, Rishikesh (25 km)
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Arrive 30 minutes early for Aarti to get viewing spot. Many arrive at start time and miss ceremony finding space.

sites.name: Rishikesh
sites.quick_version: Yoga capital of world, Beatles Ashram, Ganga rafting, adventure+spirituality.
sites.short_history: Ancient pilgrimage city, now world yoga capital. Beatles visited Maharishi Mahesh Yogi's ashram 1968. Became global spiritual hub. Adventure sports capital with Ganga rafting.
sites.mythological_significance: Lord Rama did penance here. Name means 'abode of sages'. Ganga descends through Himalayas here. Lakshman crossed Ganga here on jute rope (Laxman Jhula). Numerous ashrams and temples.
sites.rituals_and_practices: International Yoga Festival March attracts global participants. Ganga Aarti at Parmarth Niketan and Triveni Ghat. Yoga and meditation classes year-round. Ayurveda treatments. Vegetarian food only. Alcohol prohibited.
sites.local_travel_tips: Stay in Rishikesh, visit Haridwar as day trip. Book Yoga Festival accommodation 4+ months ahead. Beatles Ashram now Chaurasi Kutiya - entry ticket required, closes 6 PM. Rafting season March-June and Sept-Nov. Laxman Jhula and Ram Jhula iconic. Cafe culture vibrant. Many long-term spiritual seekers.
sites.nearby_attractions: Beatles Ashram, Laxman Jhula, Ram Jhula, Parmarth Niketan, Triveni Ghat, Neelkanth Mahadev Temple, rafting
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Beatles Ashram requires entry ticket and closes 6 PM. Many expect free entry.

sites.name: Mathura-Vrindavan
sites.quick_version: Krishna's birthplace and childhood home, Holi week madness, Braj pilgrimage circuit.
sites.short_history: Krishna born in Mathura prison, raised in Vrindavan. Entire Braj region (84 kos) sacred. Thousands of temples. Banke Bihari, Prem Mandir, Krishna Janmabhoomi major temples.
sites.mythological_significance: Mathura where Krishna born to imprison Devaki-Vasudeva to kill demon king Kansa. Vrindavan where Krishna spent childhood with Radha and gopis. Every location has story - Govardhan Hill, Nandgaon, Barsana. Represents divine love of Radha-Krishna.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Banke Bihari darshan very brief - curtains drawn repeatedly preventing mesmerization. Janmashtami midnight abhishek extremely crowded. Holi week-long - Lathmar Holi in Barsana famous. Govardhan Parikrama (21 km) highly auspicious. Yamuna aarti. Raas Leela performances.
sites.best_season: October-March (avoid extreme summer), Holi March (crowded but iconic)
sites.local_travel_tips: Mathura-Vrindavan 15 km apart. Base in Vrindavan for better atmosphere. Banke Bihari darshan 2-3 seconds - tradition. Holi needs 6-month advance booking. Explore Barsana, Nandgaon, Govardhan. Street food amazing. Pedha (sweet) specialty. Widow's Holi in Vrindavan revolutionary.
sites.nearby_attractions: Govardhan Hill, Barsana, Nandgaon, Gokul, Prem Mandir (illuminated at night), ISKCON Temple
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Banke Bihari darshan is 2-3 seconds as curtains drawn repeatedly - tradition to prevent devotees being mesmerized. Don't expect long viewing.

sites.name: Ayodhya Ram Mandir
sites.quick_version: New Ram temple at birthplace, inaugurated 2024, Ram Navami and Diwali massive.
sites.short_history: Ancient city, Lord Rama's birthplace. New temple inaugurated 22 Jan 2024 after decades-long movement. Grand structure under construction. Major pilgrimage now.
sites.mythological_significance: Ayodhya is ancient Kosala kingdom capital where Ram born. Birthplace of Ram (Ram Janmabhoomi) highly sacred. Treta Yuga capital. Sarayu river considered sacred. Entire city dotted with Ram-related sites.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Online darshan booking mandatory - no walk-ins. Security very strict. Ram Navami 9-day festival April massive. Diwali Deepotsav (world record oil lamps) spectacular. Ram Katha recitations. Hanuman Garhi nearby major shrine.
sites.local_travel_tips: Online booking mandatory 2-3 weeks advance. Carry minimal items - extensive security. Ram Navami, Diwali overwhelming. Infrastructure developing. Visit Hanuman Garhi (300 steps), Kanak Bhawan, Sarayu aarti. Photography restrictions. New airport opening soon.
sites.nearby_attractions: Hanuman Garhi, Kanak Bhawan, Sarayu River, Guptar Ghat, Dashrath Mahal
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Online booking absolutely mandatory - no walk-in allowed. Book 2-3 weeks advance. Carry minimal items for smooth security.

sites.name: Pushkar
sites.quick_version: Rare Brahma temple, sacred lake, Pushkar Camel Fair, vegetarian town.
sites.short_history: One of few Brahma temples globally. Ancient temple dating to 14th century, destroyed and rebuilt. Pushkar Lake created from Brahma's lotus petals. Town transformed during Camel Fair.
sites.mythological_significance: Pushkar Lake created when Brahma dropped lotus petals. Brahma performed yagna here. Kartik Purnima bath in lake highly auspicious. 52 ghats for bathing. No leather items allowed. Strictly vegetarian town, alcohol prohibited.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Kartik Purnima (October-November full moon) bath in lake major ritual. Brahma Temple aarti. Pushkar Camel Fair coincides with Kartik Purnima - transforms town. Savitri Temple hilltop trek. Lake circumambulation auspicious.
sites.opening_hours: Brahma Temple: 6:30 AM - 1:30 PM, 3:00 PM - 9:00 PM
sites.local_travel_tips: Pushkar Fair book 4-6 months advance. Prices triple during fair. Vegetarian food only. Alcohol prohibited. Lakeside cafes scenic. Savitri-Gayatri temple trek. No leather. Expect pushy priests at ghats - ignore or negotiate. Hot air balloon rides during fair.
sites.nearby_attractions: Pushkar Lake ghats, Savitri Temple, Gayatri Temple, Varaha Temple, Rose gardens, Ajmer Dargah (15 km)
sites.avoid_common_mistake: During Camel Fair everything triples in price. Book accommodation months ahead. Many arrive without booking and struggle.

sites.name: Trimbakeshwar Jyotirlinga
sites.quick_version: Jyotirlinga at Godavari source, Nashik Kumbh, Narayan Nagbali rituals.
sites.short_history: Source of Godavari river in Brahmagiri hills. Ancient Jyotirlinga. Nashik hosts Kumbh Mela every 12 years. Famous for Narayan Nagbali and Tripindi Shraddh ancestral rituals.
sites.mythological_significance: Ganga as Godavari flows here to cleanse sage Gautama's curse. Jyotirlinga wearing crown (unique). Represents Shiva's three faces as Brahma, Vishnu, Mahesh. Source of Godavari sacred.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Narayan Nagbali ritual for ancestral peace requires 3 days, advance booking. Tripindi Shraddh rituals prominent. Shravan Mondays peak crowds. Mahashivratri massive. Nashik Kumbh every 12 years - millions descend.
sites.local_travel_tips: Narayan Nagbali ritual 3 days - book advance with priests. Shravan Mondays 4-6 hour waits. Combine with Nashik city visit. Godavari river source trek. Anjaneri Hill (Hanuman birthplace) nearby. Nashik Kumbh every 12 years - plan accordingly.
sites.nearby_attractions: Godavari origin, Brahmagiri hills, Anjaneri Hill, Nashik wine tours, Panchavati
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Narayan Nagbali can't be done spontaneously - requires 3 days and advance priest booking. Plan ahead.

sites.name: Tiruvannamalai
sites.quick_version: Arunachaleswarar Temple, holy fire hill, Ramana Maharshi ashram, Girivalam.
sites.short_history: Ancient Pancha Bhuta Stalam representing fire element. Massive 25-acre temple complex. Arunachala Hill considered sacred fire manifestation of Shiva. Ramana Maharshi meditated here - his ashram attracts seekers globally.
sites.mythological_significance: Shiva appeared as infinite pillar of fire here. Arunachala Hill itself is Shiva. Karthigai Deepam festival lights massive lamp atop hill visible 35 km. Girivalam (hill circumambulation) 14 km barefoot highly auspicious, especially full moons.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Karthigai Deepam (November-December) 10-day festival when giant lamp lit atop hill. Full moon Girivalam (circumambulation) attracts thousands. Ramana Maharshi's Samadhi meditation powerful. Temple has daily 6 puja rituals. Early morning ablution of Shivalingam.
sites.local_travel_tips: Girivalam best early morning or evening - never noon in summer (dangerous heat). Carry water. Full moon nights magical but crowded. Ramana Maharshi Ashram peaceful meditation. Karthigai Deepam brings lakhs - book months ahead. Skandashram cave trek.
sites.nearby_attractions: Ramana Maharshi Ashram, Skandashram cave, Virupaksha cave, Sathanur Dam, Gingee Fort
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Girivalam (14 km barefoot) should never be attempted noon in summer - heat stroke risk. Early morning or evening only.

sites.name: Kanchipuram
sites.quick_version: City of thousand temples, Kailasanathar, Ekambareswarar, silk sarees.
sites.short_history: One of seven sacred cities (Sapta Puri) granting moksha. Ancient Pallava dynasty capital. Over 1000 temples historically, 126 remain. Major Tamil architecture examples. Silk weaving center.
sites.mythological_significance: Kamakshi married Shiva as Ekambareswarar under mango tree here. One of Shakti Peethas. Each temple has unique legend. Varadaraja Perumal (Vishnu) major shrine. Represents both Shiva and Vishnu worship harmony.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Temples close 12-4 PM afternoon rest. Morning 6 AM-12 PM or evening 4-8 PM visits. Brahmotsavam festivals at various temples. Vaikunta Ekadasi at Varadaraja Perumal. Silk saree shopping integral experience.
sites.local_travel_tips: Plan around 12-4 PM temple closure. Visit 5-6 major temples: Ekambareswarar, Kailasanathar, Kamakshi Amman, Varadaraja Perumal, Vaikunta Perumal. Hire guide for mythology insights. Silk saree shopping at co-operative societies authentic. Day trip from Chennai (75 km) possible.
sites.nearby_attractions: Kanchi Kamakshi Temple, Varadaraja Perumal, Kailasanathar Temple, Silk weaving centers
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Temples close 12-4 PM. Many tourists waste afternoon waiting. Plan morning or evening temple visits.

sites.name: Shani Shingnapur
sites.quick_version: Open-air Shani temple, village without doors, Saturdays insanely crowded.
sites.short_history: Unique open-air temple of Shani Dev (Saturn God). Black stone platform, no roof or walls. Village traditionally had no doors/locks - recent trend changing. Shani idol appeared mysteriously in river.
sites.mythological_significance: Shani Dev's swayambhu (self-manifested) black stone. Belief that Shani protects village, hence no doors needed historically. Saturday worship most effective as Shani's day. Oil abhishekam ritual prominent.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Saturdays see 10x crowds - Shani's day considered most auspicious. Til oil abhishekam performed. Devotees walk barefoot. No roof above deity. Queues for oil pouring can be 4-6 hours Saturdays.
sites.local_travel_tips: NEVER visit Saturday unless enjoying massive crowds. Monday-Friday 90% less crowded, equally auspicious. Ahmednagar 65 km base. Combine with Shirdi (70 km). Barefoot walking mandatory. Village losing no-door tradition.
sites.nearby_attractions: Shirdi (70 km), Ahmednagar Fort, Shani Museum
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Never visit Saturday - 10x crowds. Weekdays equally auspicious with fraction of crowd.

sites.name: Sabarimala Temple
sites.quick_version: Lord Ayyappa forest temple, 41-day vratham, women 10-50 restricted.
sites.short_history: Ancient temple in dense Western Ghats forest. Dedicated to Lord Ayyappa (celibate deity). Millions visit during Mandalam-Makaravilakku season. Recent women entry controversy.
sites.mythological_significance: Lord Ayyappa born from Shiva-Mohini (Vishnu female form) union. Celibate deity. Killed demoness Mahishi. 18 steps represent 18 hills crossed. Vratham (austerities) for 41 days mandatory before pilgrimage.
sites.rituals_and_practices: 41-day vratham - celibacy, black clothes, specific diet, barefoot. Women aged 10-50 (menstruating age) traditionally restricted - recent legal battles. Mandalam season (November-December) busiest. Makaravilakku (January) peak. Irumudi (sacred bundle) carried. 18 steps climbed barefoot.
sites.local_travel_tips: Virtual queue system mandatory - book online. 41-day vratham preparation essential. Pamba base camp for final 4 km forest trek. Physical fitness needed. Women restriction controversial - follow current rules. Guru (experienced devotee) guidance recommended for first-timers.
sites.nearby_attractions: Pampa River, Pamba base camp, Nilakkal, Sannidhanam forest
sites.avoid_common_mistake: 41-day vratham not optional - required for darshan. Many underestimate commitment needed.

sites.name: Guruvayur Temple
sites.quick_version: Guruvayurappan Krishna temple, strict dress code, elephant sanctuary.
sites.short_history: Ancient temple, rebuilt multiple times. Krishna as child deity (Guruvayurappan). Extremely strict traditional practices maintained. Non-Hindus not allowed.
sites.mythological_significance: Krishna deity installed here after Dwarka submerged. Worshipped as Guruvayurappan (Lord of Guruvayur). Elephants integral - temple maintains elephant sanctuary. Believed to cure diseases. Powerful healing deity.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Strict dress code - men dhoti only, women saree/churidar. Non-Hindus not allowed. Multiple daily poojas. Tulabharam ritual - weight in offerings. Gajapooja elephant worship. Ekadasi special. Rush hour mornings 4-7 AM.
sites.local_travel_tips: Strict dress code enforced - dhoti/mundu for men, saree/churidar for women. Western clothes prohibited. Non-Hindu restriction. Book online darshan. Elephant sanctuary (Punnathur Kotta) nearby must-visit. Temple elephant procession beautiful.
sites.nearby_attractions: Punnathur Kotta Elephant Sanctuary, Mammiyur Shiva Temple, Chavakkad Beach
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Dress code extremely strict. Western clothes will deny entry. Wear traditional attire.

sites.name: Amarnath Cave
sites.quick_version: Ice Shiva lingam in cave, challenging trek, 45-day season only.
sites.short_history: Ancient cave shrine at 3888m. Naturally formed ice lingam waxes/wanes with moon. Yatra organized by government. 45-day window July-August only.
sites.mythological_significance: Shiva revealed immortality secret to Parvati here. Natural ice lingam represents Shiva. Two smaller ice formations represent Parvati and Ganesha. Shravan month auspicious.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Yatra only during summer 45-day window when cave accessible. Two routes - Pahalgam (longer, safer) and Baltal (shorter, steeper). Registration mandatory with health certificate. Armed security due to sensitive area.
sites.local_travel_tips: Registration mandatory with medical certificate. Physical fitness crucial. High altitude risks. Two routes - Pahalgam 5 days, Baltal 2 days. Weather extreme. Helicopter expensive but available. Security situation - stay updated. Book months ahead.
sites.nearby_attractions: Pahalgam, Betaab Valley, Aru Valley, Chandanwari
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Extreme weather and altitude. Many underestimate challenge. Proper fitness and acclimatization mandatory.

sites.name: Mount Kailash-Mansarovar
sites.quick_version: Most sacred mountain, Shiva's abode, 52 km parikrama, extreme difficulty.
sites.short_history: Most sacred mountain in Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism, Bon. Unclimbed by humans. Indian government organizes annual yatra via Lipulekh Pass.
sites.mythological_significance: Shiva's eternal abode with Parvati. Center of universe in Hindu cosmology. Parikrama (circumambulation) cleanses lifetime sins. Four religions revere it. Crystal-like appearance represents cosmic axis.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Parikrama (circumambulation) 52 km at 4500-5600m altitude. Takes 3 days. Lake Mansarovar bath auspicious. Dolma La pass 5600m highest point. Yatra organized by Indian government via Lipulekh or Nepal route.
sites.local_travel_tips: Government lottery-based selection. High altitude requires serious fitness. Medical clearance mandatory. Nepal route easier than Lipulekh. Cost Rs 2-3 lakhs. Life-changing experience but physically extreme. Altitude sickness common. Many don't complete parikrama.
sites.nearby_attractions: Lake Mansarovar, Rakshas Tal, Tirthapuri hot springs
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Extremely challenging - high altitude, harsh weather. Many fail to complete. Honest fitness assessment critical.

sites.name: Gangotri Temple
sites.quick_version: Ganga origin, Chota Char Dham, Gaumukh glacier trek, seasonal opening.
sites.short_history: One of Chota Char Dham. Temple at Ganga origin from Gangotri Glacier (Gaumukh 18 km ahead). Opens May-November.
sites.mythological_significance: Ganga descended from heaven through Shiva's locks. King Bhagiratha brought Ganga to earth. Gangotri represents celestial origin. Actual source Gaumukh (cow's mouth) glacier 18 km trek from temple.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Temple opens on Akshaya Tritiya (May), closes on Diwali (November). Deity taken to Mukhba village for winter. Morning aarti spectacular. Pilgrims collect Ganga water in bottles. Gaumukh trek requires fitness.
sites.local_travel_tips: Acclimatize at Gangotri before Gaumukh trek. Opens May. Winter very cold. Gaumukh trek 18 km one-way requires permit. Road from Rishikesh scenic. Combine with other Char Dham.
sites.nearby_attractions: Gaumukh Glacier, Tapovan, Bhagirathi peaks, Pandava Gufa
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Many confuse Gangotri temple with actual Ganga source. Gaumukh glacier 18 km ahead is true source - separate trek.

sites.name: Yamunotri Temple
sites.quick_version: Yamuna origin temple, Chota Char Dham, thermal springs, difficult trek.
sites.short_history: Chota Char Dham temple at Yamuna river source. 6 km trek from Janki Chatti. Hot springs (Surya Kund) near temple. Opens May, closes Diwali.
sites.mythological_significance: Yamuna (daughter of Sun God Surya) origin. Surya Kund hot spring near temple used to cook rice/potatoes as prasad. Least visited of Char Dham, hence more serene.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Cook rice/potatoes in Surya Kund hot spring as prasad offering. 6 km trek from Janki Chatti, ponies/palanquins available. Opens Akshaya Tritiya, closes Diwali.
sites.local_travel_tips: Least crowded Char Dham. 6 km trek steep. Take cooked rice/potatoes from Surya Kund as prasad. Barkot base town. Combine with Gangotri.
sites.nearby_attractions: Surya Kund hot spring, Janki Chatti, Divya Shila, Hanuman Chatti
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Trek is steep and tiring. Many underestimate difficulty. Start early morning.

sites.name: Nathdwara Temple
sites.quick_version: Shrinathji Krishna temple, Pushti Marg tradition, pichwai paintings.
sites.short_history: Established 17th century. Shrinathji deity moved from Mathura to escape Aurangzeb. Became major Vaishnavite center. Famous for pichwai paintings and seva traditions.
sites.mythological_significance: Shrinathji is 7-year-old Krishna lifting Govardhan Hill. Deity treated as living child - woken, bathed, fed, dressed, put to sleep daily. Part of Pushti Marg (path of grace) tradition.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Eight daily darshans from morning awakening to night sleep. Photography strictly prohibited. Deity dressed elaborately - different ornaments and clothes daily. Annakut festival elaborate.
sites.local_travel_tips: No photography - strictly enforced. Darshan very brief. Pichwai painting shopping popular. Combine with Udaipur (48 km). Queue management improving.
sites.nearby_attractions: Udaipur City, Kankroli, Eklingji Temple
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Photography ban strictly enforced - don't even try. Phones confiscated if caught.

sites.name: Udupi Krishna Temple
sites.quick_version: Madhvacharya's Krishna temple, unique window darshan, Udupi cuisine birthplace.
sites.short_history: 13th century temple established by Madhvacharya (Dvaita philosophy founder). Krishna worshipped through window - unique tradition. Eight mathas (monasteries) manage temple in rotation.
sites.mythological_significance: Madhvacharya found Krishna idol in gopichandana lump. Worshipped through window (navagraha kitiki) - Krishna watching dance drama. Unique paryaya system - eight mathas take turns managing.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Daily worship through window. Paryaya festival every 2 years when temple management changes mathas. Krishna seen only through window. Strict vegetarian traditions. Udupi cuisine famous.
sites.local_travel_tips: Window darshan unique experience. Try Udupi cuisine - birthplace of dosa varieties. Malpe Beach nearby. Krishna Mutt dining hall (anna prasadam) legendary. Paryaya festival biennial.
sites.nearby_attractions: Malpe Beach, St Mary's Island, Manipal, Kaup Beach
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Darshan only through window - unique tradition. Don't expect direct viewing.

sites.name: Tarapith Temple
sites.quick_version: Tantric Tara temple, cremation ground rituals, Bamakhepa shrine.
sites.short_history: Ancient Shaktipeetha where Sati's third eye fell. Major tantric worship center. Bamakhepa (famous tantric saint) lived and practiced here. Cremation ground (shamshan) integral to temple.
sites.mythological_significance: Sati's third eye or eyeball fell here. Goddess Tara worshipped - fierce form of Shakti. Tantric traditions strong. Cremation ground considered powerfully spiritual.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Animal sacrifice practiced. Tantric rituals at cremation ground. Bamakhepa temple adjacent. Amavasya (new moon) significant. Not for faint-hearted - intense tantric atmosphere.
sites.local_travel_tips: Tantric atmosphere intense. Cremation ground visible. Animal sacrifice conducted. Amavasya and Tuesdays busiest. Bamakhepa lived here - his shrine attracts tantric practitioners. Prepare for raw spiritual power.
sites.nearby_attractions: Bamakhepa Temple, Nalhati, Tarashankar Bandopadhyay's house
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Intense tantric site with cremation ground and sacrifices. Not suitable for children or sensitive visitors.

sites.name: Brihadeeswarar Temple
sites.quick_version: UNESCO World Heritage Chola architecture, 1000-year-old, massive Nandi.
sites.short_history: Built by Raja Raja Chola I in 1010 CE. UNESCO World Heritage Site. Masterpiece of Chola architecture. 66m vimana (tower) tallest of its time. Engineering marvel - no foundation for tower.
sites.mythological_significance: Dedicated to Shiva as Brihadeeswarar. Massive Nandi (bull) - monolithic 13 ft high. Represents peak of Chola power and architectural genius. Frescoes depict Shiva legends.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Six daily pujas. Classical dance performances during festivals. Annual Natyanjali dance festival attracts dancers globally. Devotees circumambulate massive prakaram.
sites.local_travel_tips: UNESCO site - no photography inside sanctum. Architecture enthusiasts should hire guide. Natyanjali Festival February-March. Evening lighting beautiful. Combine with Thanjavur Palace and Saraswathi Mahal Library.
sites.nearby_attractions: Thanjavur Palace, Saraswathi Mahal Library, Art Gallery, Schwartz Church
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Main tower has no shadow at noon - architectural precision. Visit around noon to witness this phenomenon.

sites.name: Konark Sun Temple
sites.quick_version: UNESCO Sun Temple designed as chariot, erotic sculptures, sunrise point.
sites.short_history: 13th century CE by King Narasimhadeva I. UNESCO World Heritage Site. Designed as massive Sun God chariot with 24 wheels. Original tower collapsed. Architectural and sculptural masterpiece.
sites.mythological_significance: Dedicated to Surya (Sun God). Temple designed as his chariot with seven horses (now lost). Represents journey across sky. Erotic sculptures reflect tantric traditions and life celebration.
sites.rituals_and_practices: No longer active temple - archaeological site. Sunrise viewing popular. Konark Dance Festival December attracts classical dancers. Intricate carvings of daily life, animals, deities. 24 wheels represent hours.
sites.local_travel_tips: UNESCO site - entry fee for Indians/foreigners different. Sunrise magical. Combine with Puri (35 km). Konark Dance Festival December spectacular. Chandrabhaga Beach nearby. Allow 2-3 hours for detailed viewing. Guide recommended for mythology and symbolism.
sites.nearby_attractions: Chandrabhaga Beach, Puri (35 km), Ramchandi Temple, ASI Museum
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Not a functional temple - archaeological monument. Come for architecture, not worship.

sites.name: Ranakpur Jain Temple
sites.quick_version: Marble Jain temple, 1444 uniquely carved pillars, architectural wonder.
sites.short_history: 15th century CE. Dedicated to Adinath (first Tirthankara). 1444 marble pillars, each uniquely carved. White marble throughout. Considered finest Jain architecture specimen.
sites.mythological_significance: Dedicated to Rishabhanatha (Adinath), first Tirthankara in Jainism. Represents Jain principles of non-violence and intricate art. Each pillar unique - no two alike.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Jain prayers and ceremonies. Non-Jains welcome but leather items (shoes, belts, bags) strictly prohibited. Aarti timing. Photography restrictions inside main sanctum. Peaceful meditation atmosphere.
sites.local_travel_tips: No leather items - strictly enforced. Remove all leather before entry. Photography limited areas. Best light afternoon. Combine with Udaipur or Kumbhalgarh Fort. Peaceful environment - maintain silence. Architecture enthusiasts need 2-3 hours.
sites.nearby_attractions: Kumbhalgarh Fort (40 km), Sadri town, Sun Temple Ranakpur
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Leather ban includes belts, bags, shoes. Leave all leather in vehicle or lockers. Many tourists caught unaware.

sites.name: Dilwara Jain Temples
sites.quick_version: Marble Jain temples with intricate carvings, Mount Abu, architectural gems.
sites.short_history: Built 11th-13th century CE. Five temples, each unique. Vimal Vasahi and Luna Vasahi most famous. White marble carved with impossible intricacy. Considered pinnacle of Jain art.
sites.mythological_significance: Dedicated to various Tirthankaras. Represents Jain commitment to art, architecture, and spirituality. Each temple honors specific Tirthankara. Marble work unparalleled.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Jain worship and ceremonies. Non-Jains welcome. No leather, no photography inside. Noon to 6 PM only. Peaceful meditation. Remove shoes.
sites.local_travel_tips: No leather, no photography inside temples. Marble carvings best viewed in natural light. Mount Abu is hill station - pleasant climate. Combine with Nakki Lake, Guru Shikhar. Architecture enthusiasts should allow 2-3 hours. Maintained by trust - expect strict rules.
sites.nearby_attractions: Nakki Lake, Guru Shikhar, Mount Abu town, Achalgarh Fort
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Photography strictly prohibited inside. Don't attempt - respect religious sentiments.

sites.name: Ajmer Sharif Dargah
sites.quick_version: Sufi saint Moinuddin Chishti's shrine, qawwali music, all faiths welcome.
sites.short_history: Tomb of Sufi saint Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti (died 1236 CE). One of most important Sufi shrines in South Asia. Attracts devotees of all faiths. Urs festival annual celebration.
sites.mythological_significance: Khwaja Gharib Nawaz (benefactor of poor) - loved across religions. Sufi tradition of spiritual love and music. Qawwali tradition strong. Believed to grant wishes to sincere devotees.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Chadar (cloth) offering ceremony. Qawwali performances evening. Thursday nights special. Urs festival six days in Rajab month. All faiths welcomed. Head covering mandatory. Shoes removed at gate.
sites.local_travel_tips: Crowded always. Thursday evenings qawwali programs. Urs festival massive crowds - book months ahead. Cover head. Beware touts. Pushkar 15 km away. Ana Sagar Lake nearby. Rose products famous in Ajmer.
sites.nearby_attractions: Ana Sagar Lake, Taragarh Fort, Pushkar (15 km), Adhai Din Ka Jhonpra
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Touts and forced guides common. Politely refuse unwanted services. Fixed rates exist for offerings.

sites.name: Bodh Gaya Mahabodhi Temple
sites.quick_version: Buddha's enlightenment site, UNESCO, Bodhi Tree, global Buddhist center.
sites.short_history: Site where Buddha attained enlightenment under Bodhi Tree 2500 years ago. Current temple 5th-6th century CE. UNESCO World Heritage Site. Most sacred Buddhist pilgrimage site globally.
sites.mythological_significance: Siddhartha Gautama became Buddha (enlightened one) here after 49 days meditation. Bodhi Tree descendant of original. Vajrasana (diamond throne) marks exact enlightenment spot. Four cardinal directions have meditation areas where Buddha walked.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Meditation under Bodhi Tree. Circumambulation of temple. Offering flowers, incense, lamps. Full moon nights special. Vesak (Buddha Purnima) May massive celebration. Monasteries from every Buddhist country surrounding temple.
sites.local_travel_tips: Meditation encouraged. Visit international monasteries - Thai, Japanese, Bhutanese, Tibetan each unique. Bodh Gaya is town built around temple. Sujata Village nearby. Dungeswari Cave where Buddha practiced asceticism before enlightenment. Archaeological Museum important. Sunrise meditation special.
sites.nearby_attractions: Bodhi Tree, International Monasteries, Dungeshwari Cave, Sujata Village, Thai Temple, Archaeological Museum
sites.avoid_common_mistake: This is meditation site - maintain silence and respect. Not a tourist attraction but active pilgrimage center.

sites.name: Sarnath
sites.quick_version: Buddha's first sermon site, Dhamek Stupa, Ashoka Pillar, museum.
sites.short_history: Where Buddha gave first sermon after enlightenment - turning wheel of dharma. Ancient Buddhist university site. Ashoka built stupas and pillar here. Major archaeological Buddhist site.
sites.mythological_significance: Buddha preached first sermon to five ascetics here. Deer Park where Buddha taught Four Noble Truths and Eightfold Path. Wheel of Dharma symbol originates here. One of four main Buddhist pilgrimage sites.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Meditation at various stupas. Circumambulation of Dhamek Stupa. Visiting international temples and monasteries. Buddha Purnima major celebration. Archaeological museum houses famous Ashoka Lion Capital (India's national emblem).
sites.local_travel_tips: 10 km from Varanasi - day trip easy. Archaeological Museum (closed Fridays) houses Ashoka pillar capital. Dhamek Stupa most impressive structure. Thai, Tibetan, Japanese temples beautiful. Deer Park pleasant. Best visited morning. Combine with Varanasi sightseeing.
sites.nearby_attractions: Dhamek Stupa, Chaukhandi Stupa, Ashoka Pillar remains, Archaeological Museum, Mulagandha Kuti Vihar, Deer Park
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Museum closed Fridays. Don't miss it - houses national emblem sculpture and priceless Buddhist artifacts.

sites.name: Palitana Temples
sites.quick_version: 863 Jain temples atop Shatrunjaya Hill, 3800 steps, world's largest temple complex.
sites.short_history: Sacred Jain pilgrimage on Shatrunjaya Hill. 863 temples spanning 900 years. Climbing 3800 steps mandatory - no alternate transport. Considered most sacred Jain tirtha. First tirthankara Rishabhanatha attained moksha here.
sites.mythological_significance: Adinath (Rishabhanatha) first Tirthankara attained nirvana here. 23 of 24 Tirthankaras visited here. Most sacred mountain in Jainism. Climbing barefoot highly meritorious. Each temple represents devotion and art.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Climb 3800 steps barefoot (3.5 km, 2 hours). Start dawn. No leather. No food allowed on hill - strict. Palanquins available but frowned upon. Must descend same day - overnight stay prohibited. Non-Jains welcome with restrictions.
sites.local_travel_tips: Start 6 AM to avoid heat. 3800 steps - fitness essential. No food/water on hill. Palanquin costs Rs 3000-5000. Photography restrictions. Temples closed during monsoon July-September. Bhavnagar 50 km base. Life-changing but physically demanding.
sites.nearby_attractions: Shatrunjaya Hill, Bhavnagar city, Takhteshwar Temple
sites.avoid_common_mistake: 3800 steps not easy - assess fitness honestly. Many give up midway. No food on hill - eat before climbing.

sites.name: Belur Chennakesava Temple
sites.quick_version: Hoysala architecture masterpiece, intricate stone carvings, star-shaped platform.
sites.short_history: Built 12th century CE by Hoysala King Vishnuvardhana. Celebrates victory over Cholas. Star-shaped platform with incredibly detailed carvings. Represents peak of Hoysala architectural style.
sites.mythological_significance: Dedicated to Vishnu as Chennakesava (handsome Vishnu). Each sculpture tells Ramayana, Mahabharata, Puranic stories. Darpana Sundari (lady with mirror) sculpture famous. Madanikas (celestial dancers) unique to Hoysala style.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Active temple with daily worship. Annual Rathotsava (chariot festival). Classical dance performances during festivals. Intricate bracket figures and friezes depict entire Hindu mythology.
sites.local_travel_tips: Hire guide - each sculpture has story. Photography allowed. Combine with Halebidu (16 km) and Shravanabelagola (50 km) - Hoysala circuit. Hassan base town. Allow 2-3 hours for detailed viewing. Evening light enhances carvings.
sites.nearby_attractions: Halebidu Hoysaleswara Temple, Shravanabelagola, Yagachi Dam
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Don't rush - intricate details need time. Every inch has carved stories. Hire guide for mythology insights.

sites.name: Halebidu Hoysaleswara Temple
sites.quick_version: Twin Hoysala temple, intricate soapstone carvings, incomplete masterpiece.
sites.short_history: 12th century CE Hoysala capital temple. Never fully completed due to invasions. Twin shrines dedicated to Shiva. Star-shaped platform with incredibly detailed carvings. Soapstone allows minute detail carving.
sites.mythological_significance: Dedicated to Shiva as Hoysaleswara. Depicts entire Hindu mythology in stone. Elephant friezes unique - each different. Each wall panel tells story from epics and Puranas.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Active worship but more archaeological site than active temple. Annual festivals. Band of elephants carved around base - 2000 elephants, no two alike. Dance sequences show Natya Shastra poses.
sites.local_travel_tips: 16 km from Belur - visit both same day. Archaeological Survey of India maintains site. Guide valuable - intricate mythology. Photography allowed. Soapstone carvings softer than granite - touch carefully. Each bracket figure unique.
sites.nearby_attractions: Belur Chennakesava Temple, Shravanabelagola, Kedareshwara Temple Halebidu
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Often skipped by tourists focusing on Belur. Don't miss - equally magnificent and less crowded.

sites.name: Shravanabelagola
sites.quick_version: 57-ft Bahubali monolithic statue, hilltop Jain site, Mahamastakabhisheka every 12 years.
sites.short_history: 10th century CE monolithic statue of Bahubali (Gomateshwara). 57 feet tall, carved from single granite block. One of tallest monolithic statues globally. Mahamastakabhisheka grand abhishekam every 12 years.
sites.mythological_significance: Bahubali, son of first Tirthankara Rishabhanatha, renounced kingdom for meditation. Stood so still that vines grew on him. Represents ultimate renunciation and meditation. Mahamastakabhisheka ritual anoints statue with milk, saffron, turmeric, precious stones.
sites.rituals_and_practices: 600+ steps to reach statue on Vindyagiri Hill. Mahamastakabhisheka every 12 years - millions attend (next 2030). Devotees climb barefoot. Photography allowed. Chandragiri Hill opposite has smaller Jain temples.
sites.local_travel_tips: 600 steps - moderate climb. Combine with Belur-Halebidu (50 km). Mahamastakabhisheka planning requires years advance booking. Peaceful site. Sunrise/sunset magical. Remove shoes before climbing steps.
sites.nearby_attractions: Chandragiri Hill, Belur-Halebidu (50 km), Hassan
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Mahamastakabhisheka every 12 years draws millions. If planning to attend, book accommodation 1-2 years advance.

sites.name: Chidambaram Nataraja Temple
sites.quick_version: Cosmic dancer Nataraja temple, space element, Ananda Tandava, classical dance center.
sites.short_history: Ancient temple representing Shiva as Nataraja (cosmic dancer). One of Pancha Sabhas (five halls where Shiva danced). Represents Akasha (space) element. Classical dance tradition integral.
sites.mythological_significance: Shiva performed Ananda Tandava (cosmic dance of bliss) here. Nataraja form represents creation, preservation, destruction. Empty space in Chit Sabha (consciousness hall) represents formless divine. 108 Bharatanatyam dance poses depicted.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Six daily pujas. Evening abhishekam spectacular. Natyanjali Festival February-March attracts dancers globally. 108 karanas (dance movements) carved. Secret Chit Sabha (innermost sanctum) controversial access.
sites.local_travel_tips: Classical dance enthusiasts must visit during Natyanjali. Four gopurams represent directions. Silver-roofed Kanaka Sabha main hall. Chit Sabha innermost sanctum. Thillai Kali Temple adjacent. Photography restrictions.
sites.nearby_attractions: Pichavaram Mangrove Forest, Porto Novo, Parangipettai
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Chit Sabha (innermost sanctum) has access restrictions. Non-brahmin entry controversial - be aware of sensitivities.

sites.name: Madurai Alagar Temple
sites.quick_version: Hilltop Vishnu temple, Meenakshi's brother, Chithirai Festival connection.
sites.short_history: Ancient temple on Alagar Hills dedicated to Vishnu as Kallazhagar (beautiful deity). Connected to Meenakshi Temple mythology - Alagar is Meenakshi's brother. Dravidian architecture in forest setting.
sites.mythological_significance: Vishnu as Kallazhagar, elder brother of Goddess Meenakshi. During her wedding to Sundareshwarar, Alagar arrives late, finding wedding over. Tradition says he returns disappointed - enacted during Chithirai Festival when deity processioned to Vaigai River.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Daily worship rituals. Chithirai Festival April-May when deity taken in procession to Vaigai River for Meenakshi's wedding. Six daily pujas. Float festival in temple tank.
sites.local_travel_tips: 21 km from Madurai city. Forest surroundings peaceful. Combine with Meenakshi Temple visit. Chithirai Festival procession spectacular. Rock-cut cave temples nearby. Steps to reach main temple.
sites.nearby_attractions: Meenakshi Temple Madurai, Pazhamudhir Solai (Murugan temple), Vaigai Dam
sites.avoid_common_mistake: During Chithirai Festival, deity procession to Vaigai River is must-see part of Meenakshi's wedding celebration.

sites.name: Kanchi Kamakshi Temple
sites.quick_version: Kamakshi Amman temple, one of three major Shakti centers with Madurai and Kashi.
sites.short_history: Ancient Shaktipeetha temple. With Madurai Meenakshi and Kashi Vishwanath, forms trinity of Shakti worship. Adi Shankaracharya installed Sri Chakra here. Kamakshi in peaceful sitting posture unique.
sites.mythological_significance: Goddess Parvati performed penance under mango tree to marry Shiva. Kamakshi (one with loving eyes) represents divine mother. Sri Chakra yantra installed by Shankaracharya. Only goddess in sitting posture among major Shakti temples.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Multiple daily poojas. Fridays especially auspicious. Angapradakshinam (circumambulation of deity's body parts) unique ritual. Annual Panguni Uthiram car festival. No animal sacrifice - strictly vegetarian temple.
sites.local_travel_tips: Part of Kanchipuram temple circuit. Fridays crowded. Peaceful atmosphere compared to other major Shakti temples. Photography restrictions. Combine with other Kanchi temples. Silk saree shopping nearby.
sites.nearby_attractions: Ekambareswarar Temple, Varadaraja Perumal, Kailasanathar Temple, Silk weavers
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Sri Chakra installation by Shankaracharya makes this extremely powerful Shakti center - not just another temple.

sites.name: Virupaksha Temple Hampi
sites.quick_version: Hampi UNESCO site, Vijayanagara ruins, active temple amid monuments.
sites.short_history: Part of UNESCO Hampi ruins. Only continuously functioning temple since Vijayanagara Empire (14th century). Survived kingdom's fall. Shiva as Virupaksha (lord with matted hair) worshipped. Temple complex with gopuram, pillared halls, shrines.
sites.mythological_significance: Shiva married Pampa (Parvati) here. Hampi derived from Pampa. Site of Kishkindha kingdom from Ramayana. Monkey kingdom where Ram met Hanuman and Sugriva.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Daily worship continues despite ruins around. Evening aarti. Chariot festival April. Temple elephant blesses devotees. Tungabhadra River bathing considered purifying.
sites.local_travel_tips: Base for exploring 500+ Hampi monuments. Hire guide for UNESCO site tour. Sunrise at Matanga Hill spectacular. Vittala Temple with stone chariot must-visit. Hippie Island across river. 2-3 days needed for full exploration. Cycle/scooter rentals available.
sites.nearby_attractions: Vittala Temple, Stone Chariot, Lotus Mahal, Elephant Stables, Royal Enclosure, Tungabhadra River
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Virupaksha is active temple amid ruins - remove shoes respectfully. Many treat Hampi as only archaeological site, forgetting living worship.

sites.name: Muktinath Temple
sites.quick_version: Sacred to Hindus and Buddhists, 108 water spouts, high altitude Nepal pilgrimage.
sites.short_history: Ancient temple sacred to both Hindus (Vishnu as Muktinath) and Buddhists. Located in Nepal but major Indian pilgrimage. 108 water spouts for ritual bathing. Part of Char Dham for some traditions.
sites.mythological_significance: Vishnu attained liberation (mukti) here. Shaligrams (sacred stones) found in Kali Gandaki River. Eternal flames (water, earth, fire together) considered miraculous. Buddhists revere as place where Guru Rinpoche meditated.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Bath under 108 water spouts - considered purifying. Eternal flame worship. Shaligram collection from Kali Gandaki. Accessible only few months due to snow. Trek or flight to Jomsom then drive.
sites.local_travel_tips: Nepal visa required for Indians (free at border). Fly Pokhara-Jomsom or trek from Jomsom. High altitude - acclimatization essential. Basic facilities only. Extremely cold - warm clothes mandatory. Helicopter tours from Pokhara expensive but available.
sites.nearby_attractions: Kagbeni village, Kali Gandaki gorge, Jomsom, Marpha village, Dhumba Lake
sites.avoid_common_mistake: High altitude (3710m) - altitude sickness common. Proper acclimatization mandatory. Many underestimate challenge.

sites.name: Dakshineswar Kali Temple
sites.quick_version: Ramakrishna Paramhansa's temple, Hooghly River, Kolkata's major Kali shrine.
sites.short_history: Built 1855 by Rani Rashmoni. Famous as temple where Ramakrishna Paramhansa served as priest and attained spiritual realization. His room preserved. Spawned Ramakrishna Mission movement through disciple Vivekananda.
sites.mythological_significance: Kali as Bhavatarini worshipped. Ramakrishna's mystical experiences here transformed modern Hindu thought. Influenced global spirituality through Vivekananda's teachings. Represents synthesis of all religions.
sites.rituals_and_practices: Daily worship of Bhavatarini Kali. No animal sacrifice despite Kali temple. Ramakrishna's room museum. Hooghly River ghat for bathing. Navratri, Kali Puja major festivals. Meditation in Ramakrishna's room powerful.
sites.local_travel_tips: North Kolkata location. Combine with Belur Math (Ramakrishna Mission HQ) across river. Ramakrishna's room must-visit. Kali Puja night spectacular but crowded. Photography restrictions. River view beautiful at sunset. Metro accessible.
sites.nearby_attractions: Belur Math, Hooghly River, Adyapeath Temple, Vivekananda's house
sites.avoid_common_mistake: Main attraction is Ramakrishna connection - don't just visit temple, explore his room and absorb the spiritual atmosphere he created.
